subject: Re: [junit] command line option to suppress output results thrown on screen by junit?

Suganya,

There isn't a command-line option for that.  You could try:

1) Using junit.swingui.TestRunner, which doesn't print to the console, 
but does pop up a window.
2) Writing your own TestRunner, inspired by looking at the source of 
junit.textui.TestRunner

Good luck,

    David Saff

suganya s wrote:

> Hi,
>
> The software that I am trying to test for coverage is
> not an application program... that is it is based
> servlets and the like and hence does not have a main
> method. But If i have to test for the coverage using
> jprobe , i need to mention the application's name as
> an argument for the coverage task of junit.
>
> To solve this problem, I made a TestSuite called
> AllTests.java and added in all the suites.
> For the name of the application, I passed
> junit.textui.TestRunner and I passed AllTests as its
> argument.
>
> But when I try running the coverage task,
> jplauncher.exe after all my tests execute because of
> the failures and errors thrown on the output screen by
> junit. Is there a command line option to suppress
> junit from printing on the command line?
>
> Thanks,
> Suganya Subramanian
>
